security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code. It provides guidelines for architecture review processes with no security risks. The skill describes review procedures for backend/frontend code quality, documentation consistency, and coding standards compliance.

content.user_title: Review Architecture for Code Quality Standards
content.value_statement: Ensure your code meets architectural standards and follows established patterns. This skill provides systematic architecture reviews for consistent, maintainable codebases.
actual_capabilities: Validates backend coding standards against Google Java Style Guide
Checks frontend TypeScript strict mode compliance
Verifies DRY principle adherence and util package usage
Ensures documentation consistency across API and database changes
Reviews RESTful API design and naming conventions
limitations: Requires existing coding rules documentation files
Specific to Spring Boot and Next.js tech stacks
Needs project-specific rule files to function

use_cases.title: Architecture Consistency Reviews
use_cases.description: Ensure new code follows established architectural patterns and coding standards before merging to main branch.

use_cases.title: Code Quality Gatekeeping
use_cases.description: Automate code review processes to maintain consistent quality standards across the development team.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Integration
use_cases.description: Integrate architecture reviews into CI/CD workflows to catch design issues early in development.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Spring Boot code for architecture compliance: check package structure, naming conventions, DRY principles, and documentation updates.

prompt_templates.title: Frontend Code Standards
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this Next.js component for TypeScript strict mode compliance, proper React Hooks usage, and shadcn/ui best practices.

prompt_templates.title: API Design Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this API implementation for RESTful design principles, proper HTTP methods, and OpenAPI documentation alignment.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Architecture Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform complete architecture review on this pull request covering backend Java standards, frontend TypeScript compliance, and documentation consistency.

output: ‚úÖ Package structure: Correctly placed in controller package
‚úÖ Naming conventions: RESTful endpoint without verbs
‚ùå DRY violation: SecurityUtils.getCurrentUserId() should be used instead of manual extraction
‚ùå Documentation: New error code USER_NOT_FOUND not added to error-codes.md

best_practices: Always read project documentation before starting reviews to understand context and requirements
Focus on new changes only - avoid repeating already addressed issues from previous reviews
Provide specific, actionable feedback with file paths and line numbers for easy fixes
anti_patterns: Don't review without understanding the project's coding standards and architecture patterns
Avoid generic feedback - always reference specific rules from backend-rules.md or frontend-rules.md
Never approve code that violates mandatory requirements like @SuppressWarnings usage or any types in TypeScript

faq.question: What coding standards does this skill validate?
faq.answer: Validates against Google Java Style Guide for backend and TypeScript strict mode for frontend, plus project-specific rules.

faq.question: Can it review projects using different tech stacks?
faq.answer: Currently optimized for Spring Boot backend and Next.js frontend with shadcn/ui components only.

faq.question: How does it handle documentation updates?
faq.answer: Checks that error-codes.md, database-design.md, and api-docs.yaml are updated when relevant code changes are made.

faq.question: Is the skill safe to use on sensitive codebases?
faq.answer: Yes, it's documentation-only with no network access or code execution capabilities - purely analysis and recommendations.

faq.question: What if my project doesn't have coding rules files?
faq.answer: The skill requires existing documentation files like backend-rules.md and frontend-rules.md to function properly.

faq.question: How strict is the review process?
faq.answer: Very strict - all mandatory conditions must be met for approval, with zero tolerance for violations like @SuppressWarnings.
